page.title: 04MORFA:A SHORT HISTORY.
page.content: Morfa had the biggest Tinplate and Steelworks in Llanelli known as Richard Thomas and Baldwin mills.The Burry Tinworks opened in 1875.All these works are now closed. The Bullwarks used to be very popular for walks and picnics and people also used to pick cockles in this area. Morfa Community Centre used to be the Wesleyan Chapel.There are still plaques on the wall in memory of the the Stallard family who were killed in the Great War. Bwlch had a well known football team and many former players reached first class level. There is now a permanent Gypsy encampment in the site of an old Isolation hospital.
